segments.originalText: Speaker Nancy Pelosi sought to address the divisions within the Democratic party on whether to impeach President Trump and a dear colleague letter sent Monday. Set Monday several days after the justice department released a redacted version of Robert Mueller's explosive report Pelosi and house Democratic leaders have resisted launching impeachment proceedings. But the speaker noted in her letter that despite differences Democrats. All firmly agree that we should proceed on a path of finding the truth. It is also important to know that the facts regarding holding the president accountable can be gained outside of impeachment hearings as we proceed to uncover the truth and present additional needed reforms to protect our democracy. We must show the American people. We were proceeding free from Passion or Prejudice strictly on the presentation of fact Democratic, Senator Elizabeth Warren, a 2020 presidential candidate and other several Democratic lawmakers have called to open an impeachment inquiry into the house, but without Republican support any effort to actually remove Trump from office would fail the Senate closely has said that the Democrats could should continue to pose for the entire report be made public and to proceed with the multiple investigations into the president's.  Isis and potential obstruction of justice what a currently indictable or not. It is clear that the president has at a minimum engaged and highly unethical and unscrupulous Behavior, which does not bring honor to the office he holds.
